title: Honor 1+3/3= honor level 2. No? Apparently not.
body:
Am I crazy or was there no mention that 1+3/3 wasn't equal 2? I can Now see that 2+1/3 gives you little gems under your honor level, but prior to that? Nothing. IN every institutions I had to deal with... 3/3 = one unit of whatever the portions were. 3/3 = 1 full entity. So 1+1 = 2. 

I believe this to be Riot's mistake. {{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}

replies.body: That's three out of three Honor checkpoints, not 3/3 Honor level progress. After you hit all three checkpoints, the next change is an increase in Honor level.

This does concern retrieving the rewards for some of us, but as a general statement to this company... aren't maths supposed to be the underlying foundation of programming? We know you work on a minion-based hitbox (cluster of points which creates colliding issues,stretches and bugs) and can't come up with a better matchmaking system even after 8 years, but this... is just.............
